result.execSummary:
The defendant Montevious D Cole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Do not request early termination of probation
-------------------

miscConds.notes:
Pay a $500 fine plus court costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
-------------------

No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescriptions medications to be made known to agent and taken as prescribed. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
----------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
--------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
----------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-------------------------

timeConds.notes:
During your probation term at a rate of 50 hours each year of probation, NO BUYOUT.
--------------------------------------

45 Days jail. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court. 

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 
-------------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montevious D Cole

records.addlTxt: Defendant Montevious D Cole in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Montevious D Cole.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached an agreement. Defendant plead guilty to count #1. Upon motion of the State counts #2 and #3 are dismissed and read-in. Motion granted. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291. Court sentences defendant. Minutes filed.

Defendant Montevious D Cole in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Montevious D Cole.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Offer received. One more status, otherwise set for trial. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant in court with attorney Larry Pruden. DDA Sempf appears for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty pleas entered trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt:
2:27pm Court in session

Defendant Montevious Cole present in court with attorney Larry Pruden. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

State calls Officer Ryan Taft, duly sworn & testifies on direct by ADA Herrmann
Officer Taft identifies the Deft by where he's seated & what he's wearing, no objection by Atty Pruden. 
State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, criminal complaint into evidence. Atty Pruden objects to the Court receiving exhibit #1 into evidence, further argument.  Court will allow Atty Pruden to ask questions. ADA Herrmann objects, does not go to the basis of the complaint. Court notes Atty Pruden's objection however Court will receive exhibit #1 into evidence.
Cross-Exam by Atty Pruden
No re-direct. 
State rests, no further witnesses. 

Evidence is closed.

State's argument
Atty Pruden rests on the record.

Court finds probable cause that a felony 

State asking for 30 days for arraignment

2:34pm Court in recess
Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Montevious D Cole in court.  Attorney Larry R Pruden in court for Montevious D Cole. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Preliminary hearing rights given and hearing requested. Time period for hearing waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Montevious D Cole in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Selmek appeared for bond purposes only. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Selmek. Argument, denied. Bond remains.  Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signature bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
